title: Falkirk Council agree to close Bo'ness Recreation Centre within three months
description: Bo’ness Recreation Centre will close within three months despite a determined campaign by residents hoping to save it.

description: We spoke to the former leader of the Scottish National Party in Westminster, Ian Blackford. We asked him whether Nicola Sturgeon was wrong to say that all government messages would be available to the inquiry.

title: Driver who indecently assaulted and threatened woman loses licence
description: A Glasgow private hire car driver who indecently assaulted a woman and threatened to abduct her while working has lost his licence. Mazin Mohamed seized the passenger by the breast during the terrifying ordeal in a city street in April 2022.

title: Nicola Sturgeon denies Covid decisions were political
description: Nicola Sturgeon has denied that some of her decisions during the Covid pandemic were motivated by furthering the cause of Scottish independence. The former first minister also rejected claims she presided over a culture of secrecy despite admitting she deleted all her WhatsApps during the pandemic.

title: American XL bully ban dates confirmed for Scotland
description: XL bully dogs will be subject to new controls in Scotland New restrictions on XL bully dogs are being introduced in Scotland from 23 February. It will be legal to own one of the dogs but they must be muzzled and on a lead in public from that date.
